definition[0]: the study of the way in which money and goods are produced and used
definition[1]: the way in which money influences whether a plan, business etc will work effectively
explanation[0]: In meaning 1, economics is followed by a singular verb
example[2]: Economics is often studied with politics
explanation[1]: In meaning 2, economics is followed by a plural verb
example[3]: The economics do not add up
definition[2]: the study of the way in which wealth is produced and used
example[4]: Our consultants include a professor of economics at Harvard University.
definition[3]: calculations of whether an activity or business will be profitable or not
example[5]: The economics of producing oil from coal do not look attractive.
